Il croisa son regard, haussa un sourcil, puis commenÃ§a Ã  sourire alors qu'ils commenÃ§aient tous les deux Ã  rire.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_2_content.p6: A few moments later she brought over a plate of eggs, hash browns, and bacon with a glass of orange juice and set it in front of him. â€œYouâ€™re going to do great today Ray, I believe in you. Enjoy your breakfast and drink your orange juice, it should make your head feel better and then youâ€™ll be ready to go.â€ â€œThank you, Sil. Have I ever told you that youâ€™re the best? Because you areâ€ he said as he took a big bite of food. â€œLove youâ€ he said in a muffled voice with a mouth full of food. Sil laughed and kissed his forehead, â€œLove you tooâ€.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_2_content.p8: Raymond sat behind the big oak desk in his office, with the early morning light shining in from the window behind him and casting light onto the pile of documents he was reading. With his thumb massaging his right temple and his fingers on his forehead, he sighed and continued reading the document held in his left hand in front of him. Not only was his head still bothering him, but this case was turning out to be a bigger deal than he initially realized.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_2_content.p9: Originally, he was under the impression that this was a murder investigation with some strange circumstances, but now itâ€™s come to light that this defendant isnâ€™t just some random person. The defendant is Quinton Franks, son of the wealthy and famous politician and business owner, Mason Franks.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_2_content.p10: At a young age Mason had immigrated here with his parents, who then started a real estate business and quickly became wealthy. As he grew up, Mason loved going with his father to view the different real estate properties that were being bought and sold. This ended up providing him with many opportunities to meet other wealthy and famous people interested in the properties, including many different politicians and government officials, inspiring Mason to pursue a career in politics.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_2_content.p11: Given that Mason, even from a young age when first meeting all of these officials, left a memorable impression on them as a clever and charming young man, it came as no surprise to the community when he ended up being elected as a State senator. Shortly after Masonâ€™s election, however, his father passed away and left the family real estate business to him.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_2_content.p12: Many people worried about what would happen to either the business or Mason, thinking that there was no way he could handle both, but these worries were soon quashed when he married Cheryl Binds. Cheryl Binds, now Cheryl Franks, came from another family owned real estate business and knew exactly how to keep the business alive. Not only did she keep the business alive, but she expanded the business and began contracting towers to be built in major cities like New York, Seattle, and San Francisco, which propelled the family wealth into the top 10% of the country.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_2_content.p13: About a year after the third tower was built, Mason and Cheryl had their son Quinton. Quinton had every opportunity to excel in life. He went to prestigious schools, met many famous politicians, business owners, and actors, who were all charmed by him, just like his father Mason. The difference with Quinton, however, is that he had a tendency to deal with some of the shadier characters in the world of business and politics.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_2_content.p14: There had been at least a couple of occasions in the news where Quinton had been accused by whistleblowers for using his connections and power to influence business purchases and elections of officials that he supported, yet these officials did not seem to have the community support one would expect to see for an official that had supposedly been elected by the community. But as many of these accusations against high ranking people go, they were thrown out as hearsay and charges were dropped. The accusations did leave their mark on his reputation though, and the community had their growing suspicions and doubt of his trustworthiness.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_2_content.p15: This information reeled in Raymondâ€™s mind, making his head begin to pound again. He reached for the glass of water to his right and drank the entire glass, crunching and chewing the remaining ice as he continued to read the details of the murder Quinton was being accused of. Raymondâ€™s eyes fervently scanned line after line of text, absorbing and digesting the information, fighting off any prejudices attempting to work their way into his mind.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_2_content.p16: In the affidavit, Quinton is being accused of masterminding a plot to â€œtake care ofâ€ a problematic realtor, Mr. Jefferson, who leaked information about a scheme to launder money by purchasing property from a shady politician. Mr. Jefferson leaked documents that proved this transaction was not only money laundering, but also bribery, because Quinton actually already owned this property and essentially paid this politician as a bribe, using the purchase of property from the politician as a way to launder the money by making it look like the politician owned the property.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_2_content.p17: When Mr. Jefferson failed to come home after work, his family called the police to report him missing, because they were already aware that he had leaked this information to a reporter and were worried something may have happened to him. Later it was discovered that the day Mr. Jefferson failed to come home after work, he had been showing a new property to Quinton in a remote area. Police found CCTV footage of Quinton and Mr. Jefferson driving together in the same vehicle on the way to the property, but on the way back only Quinton could be seen in the vehicle.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_2_content.p18: Later, Mr. Jeffersonâ€™s family was told by an associate of his that he expressed worry over showing this property to Quinton alone, and then his family presented this information to police. Eventually when police found that Mr. Jefferson had â€œfallenâ€ from a cliff, and they put together the suspicious evidence, the murder charges were made against Quinton.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_2_content.p19: Despite how suspicious all of the events surrounding the case seemed and how they seemed to be pointing directly at Quinton as the prime suspect, the prosecution was hard pressed to find any other evidence to directly tie him to the crime. At the scene there was no evidence of a struggle, in the CCTV footage Mr. Jefferson did not seem to be distressed while driving on the way out there, examining both Quintonâ€™s and Mr. Jeffersonâ€™s phones yielded no incriminating or even remotely suspicious text messages, and furthermore, Quinton clearly and obviously hired the best lawyer he could afford, and he could afford more than most people in the country. Still, there was motive based on Mr. Jefferson leaking the information, Quinton was seen leaving without Mr. Jefferson after viewing the remote property, and the claims from the family and work associate about his worry to show this property to Quinton alone.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_2_content.p20: â€œWhat am I getting myself into?â€ Raymond sighed to himself, setting the documents down and leaning back in his chair. He reached for his glass of water and rubbed his temples again, but realized the glass was empty. Walking over to the pitcher to pour some more water, Raymond mentally flipped through all of the potential ways this case could play out.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_2_content.p21: In the courtroom, the case is beginningâ€¦
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_2_content.p22: â€œAll riseâ€, said the bailiff as Judge Elisando entered the courtroom from the door behind his raised desk, and approached his seat. Immediately the murmuring of the court began to quiet down, and clicks and flashes could be heard and seen as the reporters tried to get the best angles before court was in session.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_2_content.p23: â€œThank you, you may be seatedâ€, Ray said as he too sat down at his raised desk. â€œNow, letâ€™s set the record showing that this is just the preliminary hearing. After the prosecution has proclaimed the charges against the defendant and their merit for making these claims based on whatever evidence may be presented, the defense will have a chance to refute any accusations made by the prosecution and the defendant will plead either guilty or not guilty. From that point, I will make the judgment on how this case will proceed. Are we in agreement with these proceedings?â€
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_2_content.p24: â€œYes, your honorâ€, both the prosecution and defense responded simultaneously. â€œGood, then Mr. Thompson please proceedâ€, Raymond instructed. Mr. Eddie Thompson, the prosecution, thanked him as he stood up and straightened his tie.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_2_content.p25: Walking toward the bench where Judge Elisando sat listening intently, Eddie began to disseminate all of the facts to the courtroom that Ray had previously been reading about in his office. When Ray happened to look at the defendant, Quinton, however, he noticed something strange with his aura. Looking directly at Quinton, he could only see a constant bright white aura of ultra high definition being emanated, but as Ray turned to continue looking at Eddie as he laid out the charges and evidence, he noticed a faint distortion and shimmering out of the corner of his eye.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_2_content.p26: To confirm his suspicions, Ray continued to look at Eddie, but his focus was on the corner of his eye where Quinton was sitting. Sure enough, there it is. That same guilty shimmering distortion was definitely there. But how could this be? Ray had never seen anything like this before. Previously, it was always abundantly clear whether or not the defendant was guilty, but this time, it was almost as if Quinton was purposefully â€œwearingâ€ an innocent aura despite his guilty shimmering aura being emanated underneath his peculiar form of â€œclothingâ€.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_2_content.p27: `Truly, what am I getting myself into?``, Raymond thought to himself, feeling a bit worried now about how this case will turn out. Again, he focused on the corner of his eye where Quinton was calmly seated, not moving a muscle or displaying any kind of emotion whatsoever. Sure enough, that distorted shimmer was there.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_2_content.p28: Raymond subconsciously began massaging his temple with his left hand, as that deep pain started to manifest behind his eyes again. `Man, maybe I need to look into a new prescription again. These glasses seem to work just fine, but focusing on the corner of my vision like that is not making my head feel happy, thatâ€™s for sure.`, he thought, continuing to rub his left temple.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_2_content.p29: Finally, Eddie had finished presenting his charges and the evidence to support them, and the defense, Mr. Victor Broughton, stood up to begin his representation of the defendant. As Victor presented his defense, however, Ray was having trouble listening, because all he could seem to think about was how strange Quintonâ€™s aura was.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_2_content.p30: What finally ended up snapping Ray back to attention in the present moment was the defendant, Quinton, pleading â€œnot guiltyâ€. Now he knew it was his turn to carry on the show, and said â€œOnce the court has selected jurors for the trial, we will reconvene and both sides will have their opportunity to present the evidence and defense in depth to the jurors.â€ Ray stood up to leave back to his office and the bailiff once again said â€œAll riseâ€ as he walked and opened the door to his office.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_2_content.p31: Closing the door behind him, Ray let out a deep sigh and began massaging both of his temples, wincing at the pain behind his eyes. He walked back over to his office chair and took several swigs of the barely cool water left in his glass covered in condensation from the melted ice. Once the glass was empty, he inadvertently set the glass down forcefully which ended up shattering all over his desk and onto the floor.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_2_content.p32: â€œDamnitâ€, he said to himself. Thatâ€™s when the unsettling thought occurred to him, what if this is an omen or a symbol of how this case will end up? But if it is, whoâ€™s the one that will end up shattered and in pieces, him or Quinton? Ray swallowed dryly and thought, `I hope not me`, but his gut was telling him something differentâ€¦
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p1: Later that evening, Ray arrived at home with his mind still swimming from how this first hearing with the Quinton case went. He walked in the door and said, â€œHey Silly, Iâ€™m home nowâ€, while kicking off his shoes and putting them on the shoe rack by the front door. â€œIâ€™m in the kitchen fixing up dinner right now, come give me a kiss and tell me how it went,â€ she responded from around the corner in the kitchen.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p2: Ray walked into the kitchen and came behind Sil to give her a hug as she was chopping vegetables. She turned her head and they kissed, then she set down the knife, rinsed her hands, and turned to face him. â€œSo, how was the first hearing today? Did it go well? Also, howâ€™s your head feeling now? I hope that breakfast this morning did the trick for you.â€ Ray let out a sigh and trailed off saying, â€œWellâ€¦ letâ€™s just say Iâ€™ve got my work cut out for me. This is not as cut and dry as I expected it would be, but I guess thatâ€™s my fault for not expecting there to be so much uncertainty. With promotions comes more difficult cases I suppose. And I still have a slight headache, but your breakfast definitely kicked me into gear this morning, thank you.â€
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p3: Sil gave him another kiss, looked him in his eyes, and said, â€œI believe in you Ray. Itâ€™s not going to be easy, but you will make the right call, you always do. Why donâ€™t you get some comfy clothes on and go watch some TV? Iâ€™ll have dinner finished soon and Iâ€™ll bring it over to you.â€ â€œYou are incredible Sil, thank you for being so good to me. I treasure you, and I love your cooking,â€ he said and they both chuckled at the last statement. They kissed again and he went to swap out his work clothes for comfy clothes.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p4: After getting his comfy clothes on and some slippers, he came and plopped down onto the couch, grabbed the TV remote and clicked to turn it on. `Alright, time to relax and catch up on some news for the day`, Ray thought as he actually began to relax finally. For the first time today, he noticed that his head was finally beginning to feel better. `Huh, mustâ€™ve been stress related since my head is finally feeling better now that Iâ€™m relaxing`, he pondered to himself.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p5: He clicked through the channels and set the remote down after finding his usual news station. â€œ...so make sure you wear some sunblock tomorrow folks, itâ€™s going to be hot and bright. Thankfully, we will have some cloud cover tomorrow evening though and things will cool down quite a bit. Over to you with todayâ€™s updates, John.â€ the weather forecaster said, with the stream changing over to the news anchor John sitting at his desk, papers in hand and a smile on his face.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p6: â€œThanks for the tip Ted! Iâ€™ll have my sunblock ready for tomorrow. In todayâ€™s news, boy do we have a big story for you folks. Well, rather weâ€™re going to have a big story for you thatâ€™s set to unfold over the coming weeks, potentially months. Quinton Franks, son of State Senator and real estate mogul Mason Franks, is now being accused of murdering one of his real estate agents that recently leaked information. Yes folks, the report of the potential money laundering and bribery that we mentioned here previously is the leaked information Iâ€™m talking about. Thereâ€™s sure to be some eyes on this case, but Judge Raymond Elisando is set to preside over it and he seems to be on fire recently, so weâ€™ll be keeping a close eye on how things are progressingâ€¦â€ news anchor John said. â€œWeâ€™ll be back just after this, folks, stay tuned!â€
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p7: Ray let out another long sigh, and felt his head start pounding again. `Sheeshâ€¦ This is crazy. The first hearing was just earlier today and theyâ€™re already all over the story. My head is definitely not happy about this, ugh. I need some water,` Ray thought, massaging his temples again as he got up to get a glass of water. â€œAh, sit down mister. Iâ€™ve got your water right here, and Iâ€™ll be right back with dinner,â€ Sil said, catching him before he got all the way up. â€œYou are good!â€ Ray laughed, as he sat back down. She leaned over and kissed him, before turning back around to grab the plates of dinner.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p8: With three big gulps of ice cold water, Ray let out a sigh of satisfaction, setting the glass down on the coffee table. A moment later Sil brought over two steaming plates of dinner, followed by another two plates with pumpkin pie and whipped cream on top. His eyes were immediately drawn away from the TV to the plates of pumpkin pie, and then he looked at Sil asking, â€œPumpkin pie? What are you doing to me, woman? Trying to fatten me up and make me fall even more in love with you?â€. He mocked wiping drool from his lips and loudly slurping it up, making her laugh heartily. She leaned in and gave him several quick kisses all over his lips and cheeks, replying â€œLooks like my diabolical plan is workingâ€ while winking at him.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p9: Sil grabbed the remote, turning the TV off, and they both held hands and closed their eyes to pray. â€œDear heavenly Father, firstly, thank You so much for everything that youâ€™ve already blessed us with. We ask that you bless this food and heal our bodies, and please give Ray the strength and discernment he needs to make the right judgements when presiding over this case. In Your name we pray, Jesus, Amenâ€. Ray opened his eyes and looked directly at Sil, full of love and gratitude, then kissed her for a long moment before finally saying, â€œThank you, Sil, I love you and I treasure you very much. Iâ€™m already feeling better. Now, letâ€™s dig into this delicious feast youâ€™ve made!â€
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p10: They both ate in silence, taking extra time to savor the delicious homemade pumpkin pie with whipped cream, then cleaned up the dishes. After a while, when they had both gotten ready for bed and crawled in together under the covers, they kissed again and wished each other a goodnight before turning the lights out. Surprisingly, Ray was able to fall asleep rather quickly this evening, and he drifted deeply into a dreamâ€¦
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p11: Ray stood there in the hallway, just outside of the courtroom still wearing his Judgeâ€™s gown, and he was surrounded by reporters all holding up microphones and cameras that were flashing and clicking. They were almost like animals surrounding their prey, snarling and nearly foaming at the mouth as they asked him questions, pushing closer and closer to him. â€œWhat are you going to do about this case? Whereâ€™s your secret power now?â€, one reporter shouted, catching Ray by surprise. â€œYeah Ray! Yeah! What about it? Do you really think your secret power is working? Can you trust it? Can we trust you?â€, another reporter snarled viciously at him.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p12: â€œOrder! Order in the court!â€ Ray shouted over all the noise. â€œWeâ€™re not in court anymore, Ray! You have no power here! No order!â€ someone in the crowd screamed at him. Ray wiped beads of sweat from his forehead, trying to calm himself down and think of how to handle this crazy situation heâ€™d gotten himself into. â€œListen! You donâ€™t understand, itâ€™s not that easy. Just give me a chance to explaiâ€¦â€, he was immediately cut off by hands beginning to grab at his gown, tearing it in the process. He kept getting pulled back and forth by the crowd untilâ€¦
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p13: â€œAhhh! What are you doing!? Stop!â€ he shouted, trying to pull away from the reportersâ€™ mouths biting at his arms, back, and legs. His shouts fell on deaf ears, however, with more snarling and biting reporters climbing over each other to get a piece of him.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p14: â€œAhhhhh, ahhhhh, ahhhh!!!!â€ Ray screamed and thrashed in his sleep, waking up Sil in the process. â€œRay! Wake up, wake up!â€, she shouted as she shook him awake. â€œYouâ€™re okay, itâ€™s just a dreamâ€, she said as he sat up and wiped beads of sweat from his forehead. â€œOhhh, wow, umâ€¦â€ Ray stuttered shakily. â€œY-yes, I-Iâ€™m okay. Wow, what an insane dream.â€
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p15: â€œDo you want to talk about it?â€ Sil asked him softly. He reached over to the nightstand on his left, grabbed the glass of water, and drank the whole glass in a few large gulps. Wiping the remaining beads of sweat from his forehead, he turned to look at Sil and replied, â€œNo, Iâ€™m okay now. Youâ€™re right, it was just a bad dream. I guess Iâ€™ve got some worries about this case, but itâ€™s nothing I canâ€™t handle. Iâ€™ll be alright.â€ She looked at him for a moment, concern showing in the wrinkles of her scrunched expression. â€œAlright, well, if you change your mind or want to talk in the morning then you know Iâ€™m always here for you. I love you, please try to get some more restâ€, she responded.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p16: â€œI love you too, and sure, of courseâ€, Ray said as he lay back down. Despite calming down and closing his eyes, he could only seem to toss and turn in bed, filled with worried thoughts of what that insane dream could possibly mean. Then, after what seemed like hours, he finally drifted back off to sleep.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p18: Raymond sat there in the driver seat of his car, gripping the steering wheel tightly with white knuckles as he saw the parade of news vans and cars parked just up the road, in front of the courthouse. `Damn, again? Theyâ€™re like vultures! They circle around their prey, waiting for just the right moment to dive and tear into their next meal. Is it me, or is it Quinton that theyâ€™re circling though?` he thought as he clenched his teeth. â€œAgh!â€ he shouted, slamming the palm of his hand down onto the steering wheel, then turned to go into the parking garage behind the courthouse.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p19: He parked and went straight to his office. Once again thoughts were swimming through his mind, only this time he could feel their pace quickening as they approached the inevitable waterfall into anxiety and insanity. How appropriate this waterfall in his mind was, given the fact that Mr. Jefferson happened to have fallen, or potentially have been pushed, off of a cliff. The incessant sound of murmuring voices in the hallway from all of the reporters didnâ€™t help things either. Today was the day when Ray would have to give his speech to the media and announce the date on which the verdict would be made regarding this case.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p20: Normally, a case like this would span months, but it seemed as though Quinton really wanted to exercise his right to a fair and especially speedy trial. His lawyers had continuously bombarded Ray with notices and motions and requests to move forward with this. It was as if he was being pressured to make a hasty decision, but why? Wouldnâ€™t a hasty decision potentially give Quinton a verdict he wouldnâ€™t be happy with? But wait, why even care about whether or not Quinton would be happy with the verdict? This is about making the right decision, not keeping the defendant happy.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p21: Ray opened the top drawer on the right side of his desk and grabbed a bottle of Paracetamol, twisted the cap and popped several of the pills into his mouth. He swallowed dryly, nearly gagging in the process, and then began massaging his temples. Lately it seemed like he was beginning to have more and more headaches, but he continued to attribute these to the growing stress of this case. `If these headaches donâ€™t quit after Iâ€™m done presiding over this case, Iâ€™ll go to a doctor.` he thought to himself, exhaling sharply.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p22: Looking at the watch on his left wrist, he saw that it was time to give the speech and he took in three deep breaths to calm his nerves. â€œOkay, letâ€™s do this, '' he said to himself, gathering up his strength and confidence. He walked over to the door that led to the hallway filled with the incessant murmuring of the reporters, took in one last deep breath, then twisted the handle and opened the door.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p23: Immediately numerous camera clicks could be heard as the flashes illuminated the hallway like strobe lights. Fortunately, this time Raymond had a podium to stand behind as he gave his speech to the reporters, unlike his dream where he had been surrounded by ravenous and almost inhuman reporters.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p24: He cleared his throat and straightened his tie as he stood behind the podium, prompting all of the reporters and attendees to quiet down for his speech. â€œI would just like to preface this speech by reiterating that we do respect the presumption of innocence until proven guilty here, and the fact that we are moving forward with the case against Quinton Franks does not mean anything without proof beyond a reasonable doubt. That being said, we do have reason to believe that this case is worth a judgeâ€™s ruling in addition to a trial. The trial will be held next week on Monday, beginning at 8am and will span three days. I will use the following two days after the trial to review all evidence that has been submitted, as well as the findings of the jury. The Monday of the following week will be when a judgment is announced. If Mr. Quinton Franks is found to be innocent, then all charges will be dropped. If Mr. Quinton Franks is found to be guilty, then a separate hearing will be held to determine the sentencing, which will occur the following Monday after the verdict has been announced.â€
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p25: Ray slowly took in another deep breath, and then announced that he will take a few questions. â€œI will now allow questions and Iâ€™ll answer to the best of my ability. Remember, this is still an open case so I will not be answering any questions about the case itself, and I will not be answering any questions regarding my opinions about this case.â€
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p26: Immediately the reporters all began asking questions, each reporter trying to be louder than the others in order for their question to be heard. It felt like chaos, and immediately Ray began to feel a bead of sweat rolling down the side of his face as he remembered the nightmare. Wiping away the sweat, he listened for a clear question which he was able to answer.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p27: â€œJudge Elisando, can you please tell us whether or not youâ€™ve ever presided over a murder case like this before, and why youâ€™re the judge who has been deemed qualified to preside over this particular case?â€ a reporter in the middle of the crowd shouted. Raymond cleared his throat to signal the reporters to be quiet so he could answer, and then responded by saying, â€œFirst, Iâ€™d like to say that I have presided over hundreds of cases during my career, including cases involving manslaughter, murder, burglary, and many other charges. Each case is unique, despite circumstances sometimes seeming similar to other cases, so in that respect, no, I have never presided over a murder case like this before. I am, however, indeed qualified to preside over this case and I have no doubts that I will make a lawful decision based objectively on all of the evidence provided, and I will take into consideration the decision of the jury. The Governor is aware of the publicity and high-profile nature of this case, and he himself decided I would be the one to preside over this case. I trust his decision, and I trust my judgments.â€ â€œThank you Judge Elisando!â€ the reporter said, while jotting down notes onto his iPad.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p28: The reporters again began to shout over one another as they asked all different kinds of questions. After responding to the first question, however, Ray felt much more confident and he answered questions for the remaining time without any issue.  `Hah, and to think I was fretting about this meeting as if it would happen as it had in my dream. That actually went surprisingly well. Maybe tonight Iâ€™ll finally get some good sleep again`, he thought. Soon, he was heading home and finally feeling good about moving forward with this caseâ€¦
